info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 12 at 10:23PM CDT until April 12 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LAFAYETTE AND SOUTHWESTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES... WEBSTER...WESTERN CLAIBORNE...NORTH CENTRAL BIENVILLE...NORTHEASTERN BOSSIER AND WEST CENTRAL LINCOLN PARISHES... At 1023 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Bradley to near Haughton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Minden, Magnolia, Springhill, Homer, Haughton, Arcadia, Haynesville, Sibley, Cullen, Cotton Valley, Gibsland, Sarepta, Doyline, Bradley, Taylor, Emerson, Dubberly, Dixie Inn, Shongaloo and Bussey. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...and north central and northwestern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
